purpose: Streamline the development of agent-based applications by handling low-level operations like tool calling, prompt routing, and input clarification.
principle: Built on top of Envoy proxy server, leveraging its capabilities for routing and observability, while integrating with various LLMs and APIs.
reusability: Offers a flexible architecture with APIs for easy integration into existing systems, enabling developers to plug-and-play with different models and tools.
limitations: Primarily focused on AI-native applications, may require customization for specific use cases or non-standard integrations.
name: archgw
description: The AI-native proxy server for agents. Arch handles the pesky low-level work in building agentic apps like calling specific tools, routing prompts to the right agents, clarifying vague inputs, unifying access and observability to any LLM, etc.
highlight: Provides a unified interface for routing prompts and managing interactions with multiple LLMs and tools.
